intro: Psychotria platycocca, commonly known as the broad-cocci psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Psychotria platycocca is also noted for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its applications.
